definitions.definition: Terminating in a point or edge, especially one that can cut or pierce easily ; not dull , obtuse , or rounded .
examples: I keep my knives sharp so that they don't slip unexpectedly while carving.
Ernest made the pencil too sharp and accidentally stabbed himself with it.
A face with sharp features
My nephew is a sharp lad; he can count to 100 in six languages, and he's only five years old.

definitions.definition: Raised by one semitone (denoted by the symbol ♯ after the name of the note).

examples: The orchestra's third violin several times was sharp about an eighth of a tone.

definitions.definition: Having a strong acrid or acidic taste .
examples: Milly couldn't stand sharp cheeses when she was pregnant, because they made her nauseated.
This grapefruit is especially sharp .
A pregnant woman during labor normally experiences a number of sharp contractions.
The man turned and made a sharp movement towards the door.
Michael had a number of sharp ventures that he kept off the books.

definitions.definition: Keenly or unduly attentive to one's own interests; shrewd , verging on dishonest.
examples: a sharp dealer, a sharp customer, sharp practice
You'll need sharp aim to make that shot.

definitions.definition: Offensive , critical , or acrimonious ; stern or harsh .
examples: sharp criticism
When the two rivals met, first there were sharp words, and then a fight broke out.
You look so sharp in that tuxedo!
Keep a sharp watch on the prisoners. I don't want them to escape!
Jones, the centre forward, made a sharp start to the game.
a sharp contrast, a sharp distinction

definitions.definition: Forming a small or tight angle ; especially, forming an angle of less than ninety degrees .
examples: Drive down Main for three quarters of a mile, then make a sharp right turn onto Pine.
a sharp turn or curve
a sharp ascent or descent

definitions.definition: Said of as extreme a value as possible.
examples: Sure, any planar graph can be five-colored. But that result is not sharp : in fact, any planar graph can be four-colored. That is sharp : the same can't be said for any lower number.
That
a sharp pain; the sharp and frosty winter air

definitions.definition: Eager or keen in pursuit ; impatient for gratification .
examples: a sharp appetite

definitions.definition: Composed of hard, angular grains ; gritty .
Uttered in a whisper, or with the breath alone; aspirated ; unvoiced .

main_definition: Terminating in a point or edge, especially one that can cut or pierce easily ; not dull , obtuse , or rounded .
secondary_definitions: ( music ) Raised by one semitone (denoted by the symbol ♯ after the name of the note).
( music ) Higher in pitch than required.
Having a strong acrid or acidic taste .
( colloquial ) Keenly or unduly attentive to one's own interests; shrewd , verging on dishonest.
Offensive , critical , or acrimonious ; stern or harsh .
Forming a small or tight angle ; especially, forming an angle of less than ninety degrees .
( mathematics , of a statement ) Said of as extreme a value as possible.
Eager or keen in pursuit ; impatient for gratification .
( obsolete ) Fierce ; ardent ; fiery ; violent ; impetuous .
Composed of hard, angular grains ; gritty .
( phonetics , dated ) Uttered in a whisper, or with the breath alone; aspirated ; unvoiced .
